Title: In Defence of the Pull Request
Description: Code reviews aren‚Äôt the developer‚Äôs primary responsibility, and often there is more than one round of changes to review. There‚Äôs always one person in the way to wrap up work, leaving snarky comments. Pull requests take time, resulting in long-lived feature branches and violation of continuous-integration principles. And, despite thorough reviews, bugs still make their way into production. Pull requests are neither efficient nor effective; they slow down delivery and contribute to toxic environments.

Title: Counterfactuals are not Causality - Wide Awake Developers

As often happens with a problem in our systems, we noticed it first in terms of the visible error, which we could state as ‚ÄúBuilds did not complete.‚Äù Now we want to trace backwards to figure out what happened. A common technique is the ‚ÄúFive Whys‚Äù popularized by Lean thinking. So we ask ‚ÄúWhy did builds not complete‚Äù and we find ‚ÄúKubernetes could not start the pod, and the operation timed out after 1 hour.
